result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Scott Waltemath was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Unlawful Phone Use-Threaten w/ Obscenity [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant ordered to have a Domestic Abuse Assessment and follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended.

Parenting class and follow through with any recommendations.

Behavioral thinking program.

Comply with any conditions per agent.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

timeConds.notes: 90 days jail concurrent with 14CM39 and consecutive to 13CF36

Additional 6 months jail imposed and stayed pending judicial review hearing.  Agent to schedule judicial review hearing 1 year into probationary period, unless determined to be necessary sooner.
6 months jail concurrent with 14CM39

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
